result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar L Gooch III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oscar L Gooch III appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Oscar L Gooch III.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, parties request an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Oscar L Gooch III appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Oscar L Gooch III.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Oscar L Gooch in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee police officer Christopher Spankowski. State rests. Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Oscar L Gooch in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Ryan Jay Michaels for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a State v. Lee hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel has been appointed and a hearing is no longer needed. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.   Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Oscar L Gooch in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Oscar L Gooch in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. State's witness present. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KEG EXCEPT as permitted by a Children's Court or DMCPS order.

Defendant Oscar L Gooch in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/22 @ 1p
